verses.verse: Now Jephthah<WH3316> the Gileadite<WH1569> was a mighty man<WH1368> of valor<WH2428>, and he was the son<WH1121> of an prostitute<WH802>: and Gilead<WH1568> fathered<WH3205> Jephthah<WH3316>.

And Gilead<WH1568>'s wife<WH802> bore<WH3205> him sons<WH1121>; and his wife<WH802>'s sons<WH1121> grew up<WH1431>, and they thrust out<WH1644> Jephthah<WH3316>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH5157>, You shall not inherit in our father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>; for you are the son<WH1121> of a strange<WH312> woman<WH802>.

Then Jephthah<WH3316> fled<WH1272> from<WH6440> his brothers<WH251>, and lived<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Tob<WH2897>: and there were gathered<WH3950> vain<WH7386> men<WH582> to Jephthah<WH3316>, and went out with him<WH3318>.
And it came to pass in process of time<WH3117>, that the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> made war<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>.

And it was so<WH1121>, that when the sons of Ammon<WH5983> made war<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>, the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> went<WH3212> to fetch<WH3947> Jephthah<WH3316> out of the land<WH776> of Tob<WH2897>:
And they said<WH559> unto Jephthah<WH3316>, Come<WH3212>, and be our captain<WH7101>, that we may fight<WH3898> with the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> said<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568>, Did not you hate<WH8130> me<WH1644>, and expel me out of my father<WH1>'s house<WH1004>? and why are you come<WH935> unto me now when you are in distress<WH6887>?

And the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> said<WH559> unto Jephthah<WH3316>, Therefore we turn again<WH7725> to you now<WH1980>, that you may go with us<WH3898>, and fight against the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and be our head<WH7218> over all the inhabitants<WH3427> of Gilead<WH1568>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> said<WH559> unto the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568>, If you bring me home again<WH7725> to fight<WH3898> against the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, and the Lord<WH3068> deliver<WH5414> them before<WH6440> me<WH7218>, shall I be your head?
And the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> said<WH559> unto Jephthah<WH3316>, The Lord<WH3068> be witness<WH8085> between us<WH6213>, if we do not so according to your words<WH1697>.

Then Jephthah<WH3316> went<WH3212> with the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568>, and the people<WH5971> made<WH7760> him head<WH7218> and captain<WH7101> over them<WH3316>: and Jephthah uttered<WH1696> all his words<WH1697> before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068> in Mizpeh<WH4709>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto the king<WH4428> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, saying<WH559>, What have you to do with me<WH935>, that you are come against me to fight<WH3898> in my land<WH776>?

And the king<WH4428> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> answered<WH559> unto the messengers<WH4397> of Jephthah<WH3316>, Because Israel<WH3478> took away<WH3947> my land<WH776>, when they came up<WH5927> out of Egypt<WH4714>, from Arnon<WH769> even unto Jabbok<WH2999>, and unto Jordan<WH3383>: now therefore restore those lands again<WH7725> peaceably<WH7965>.
And Jephthah<WH3316> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> again<WH3254> unto the king<WH4428> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>:
And said<WH559> unto him<WH559>, Thus says Jephthah<WH3316>, Israel<WH3478> took not away<WH3947> the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, nor the land<WH776> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>:
But when Israel<WH3478> came up<WH5927> from Egypt<WH4714>, and walked<WH3212> through the wilderness<WH4057> unto the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>, and came<WH935> to Kadesh<WH6946>;

Then Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto the king<WH4428> of Edom<WH123>, saying<WH559>, Let me<WH5674>, I pray you, pass through your land<WH776>: but the king<WH4428> of Edom<WH123> would not listen<WH8085> thereto<WH7971>. And in like manner they sent unto the king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>: but he would<WH14> not consent<WH3478>: and Israel lived<WH3427> in Kadesh<WH6946>.

Then they went along<WH3212> through the wilderness<WH4057>, and compassed<WH5437> the land<WH776> of Edom<WH123>, and the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, and came<WH935> by the east side<WH4217> of the land<WH776> of Moab<WH4124>, and pitched<WH2583> on the other side<WH5676> of Arnon<WH769>, but came<WH935> not inside the border<WH1366> of Moab<WH4124>: for Arnon<WH769> was the border<WH1366> of Moab<WH4124>.

And Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> unto Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of the Amorites<WH567>, the king<WH4428> of Heshbon<WH2809>; and Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto him<WH5674>, Let us pass, we pray you<WH776>, through your land into<WH5704> my place<WH4725>.

But Sihon<WH5511> trusted<WH539> not Israel<WH3478> to pass<WH5674> through his coast<WH1366>: but Sihon<WH5511> gathered<WH622> all his people<WH5971> together<WH622>, and pitched<WH2583> in Jahaz<WH3096>, and fought<WH3898> against Israel<WH3478>.

And the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> delivered<WH5414> Sihon<WH5511> and all his people<WH5971> into the hand<WH3027> of Israel<WH3478>, and they struck<WH5221> them<WH3478>: so Israel possessed<WH3423> all the land<WH776> of the Amorites<WH567>, the inhabitants<WH3427> of that country<WH776>.
And they possessed<WH3423> all the coasts<WH1366> of the Amorites<WH567>, from Arnon<WH769> even unto Jabbok<WH2999>, and from the wilderness<WH4057> even unto Jordan<WH3383>.
So now the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> has dispossessed<WH3423> the Amorites<WH567> from before<WH6440> his people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, and should you possess it<WH3423>?

Will not you possess<WH3423> that which Chemosh<WH3645> your god<WH430> gives you to possess<WH3423>? So whomever the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> shall drive out<WH3423> from before<WH6440> us<WH3423>, them will we possess.

And now are you any thing better<WH2896> than Balak<WH1111> the son<WH1121> of Zippor<WH6834>, king<WH4428> of Moab<WH4124>? did he ever<WH7378> argue<WH7378> against Israel<WH3478>, or did he ever<WH3898> fight against them<WH3898>,

While Israel<WH3478> lived<WH3427> in Heshbon<WH2809> and her towns<WH1323>, and in Aroer<WH6177> and her towns<WH1323>, and in all the cities<WH5892> that be along by the coasts<WH3027> of Arnon<WH769>, three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> years<WH8141>? why therefore did you not recover<WH5337> them inside that time<WH6256>?

Why I have not sinned<WH2398> against you<WH6213>, but you do me wrong<WH7451> to war<WH3898> against me<WH3068>: the Lord the Judge<WH8199> be judge<WH8199> this day<WH3117> between the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> and the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.
But the king<WH4428> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> listened<WH8085> not unto the words<WH1697> of Jephthah<WH3316> which he sent him<WH7971>.

Then the Spirit<WH7307> of the Lord<WH3068> came upon Jephthah<WH3316>, and he passed over<WH5674> Gilead<WH1568>, and Manasseh<WH4519>, and passed over<WH5674> Mizpeh<WH4708> of Gilead<WH1568>, and from Mizpeh<WH4708> of Gilead<WH1568> he passed over<WH5674> unto the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.
And Jephthah<WH3316> vowed<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> unto the Lord<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, If you shall outside fail<WH5414> deliver<WH5414> the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> into my hands<WH3027>,

Then it shall be<WH3318>, that whatever comes forth<WH3318> of the doors<WH1817> of my house<WH1004> to meet<WH7125> me<WH7725>, when I return in peace<WH7965> from the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, shall surely be the Lord<WH3068>'s, and I will offer it up<WH5927> for a burnt offering<WH5930>.
So Jephthah<WH3316> passed over<WH5674> unto the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> to fight<WH3898> against them<WH3068>; and the Lord delivered<WH5414> them into his hands<WH3027>.

And he struck<WH5221> them from Aroer<WH6177>, even until you come<WH935> to Minnith<WH4511>, even twenty<WH6242> cities<WH5892>, and unto the plain<WH58> of the vineyards<WH3754>, with a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> slaughter<WH4347>. Thus the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> were subdued<WH3665> before<WH6440> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And Jephthah<WH3316> came<WH935> to Mizpeh<WH4709> unto his house<WH1004>, and<WH1323>, behold, his daughter came out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> him with tambourines<WH8596> and with dances<WH4246>: and she was his only child<WH3173>; beside her he had neither son<WH1121> nor<WH176> daughter<WH1323>.

And it came to pass<WH7200>, when he saw her<WH7167>, that he tore his clothes<WH899>, and said<WH559>, Alas<WH162>, my daughter<WH1323>! you have brought<WH3766> me very<WH3766> low<WH3766>, and you are one of them that trouble<WH5916> me<WH6475>: for I have opened my mouth<WH6310> unto the Lord<WH3068>, and I cannot<WH3201> go back<WH7725>.

And she said<WH559> unto him<WH1>, My father, if you have opened<WH6475> your mouth<WH6310> unto the Lord<WH3068>, do<WH6213> to me according to that which<WH834> has proceeded<WH3318> out of your mouth<WH6310>; forasmuch<WH310> as the Lord<WH3068> has taken<WH6213> vengeance<WH5360> for you of your enemies<WH341>, even of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>.

And she said<WH559> unto her father<WH1>, Let this thing<WH1697> be done<WH6213> for me<WH7503>: let me alone two<WH8147> months<WH2320>, that I may go up<WH3212> and down<WH3381> upon the mountains<WH2022>, and bewail<WH1058> my virginity<WH1331>, I and my fellows<WH7464>.

And he said<WH559>, Go<WH3212>. And he sent her away<WH7971> for two<WH8147> months<WH2320>: and she went<WH3212> with her companions<WH7464>, and bewailed<WH1058> her virginity<WH1331> upon the mountains<WH2022>.

And it came to pass at the end<WH7093> of two<WH8147> months<WH2320>, that she returned<WH7725> unto her father<WH1>, who did<WH6213> with her according to his vow<WH5088> which he had vowed<WH5087>: and she knew<WH3045> no man<WH376>. And it was a custom<WH2706> in Israel<WH3478>,
That the daughters<WH1323> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH3212> yearly<WH3117> to lament<WH8567> the daughter<WH1323> of Jephthah<WH3316> the Gileadite<WH1569> four<WH702> days<WH3117> in a year<WH8141>.
